ground_truth_articulation: Classify as true if the input contains a URL pattern starting with 'http' or 'www'.
generated_articulation: **The input is classified as True if and only if it contains a URL (starting with http://, https://, or www.). Otherwise, it is classified as False.**
raw_response:
# Analysis

Let me examine the True and False cases systematically:

**True cases:**
- "result input value data www.website.com" - contains URL
- "jumps text http://test.org" - contains URL
- "function run www.example.net" - contains URL
- "fox value www.example.net" - contains URL
- "sat lazy quick www.example.net" - contains URL
- "input result http://test.org" - contains URL
- "python sample text hello https://example.com" - contains URL
- "cat brown https://example.com" - contains URL
- "value test http://test.org" - contains URL
- "output input www.website.com" - contains URL

**False cases:**
- "sample cat value" - no URL
- "the jumps sample" - no URL
- "text test value" - no URL
- "world world lazy" - no URL
- "output data the code" - no URL
- "cat code result" - no URL
- "fox run dog" - no URL
- "testing world" - no URL
- "text jumps" - no URL
- "text run jumps" - no URL

# Rule

**The input is classified as True if and only if it contains a URL (starting with http://, https://, or www.). Otherwise, it is classified as False.**
llm_judge_reasoning: Both rules aim to classify inputs as true when they contain URLs starting with 'http', 'https', or 'www'. The ground truth specifies patterns starting with 'http' or 'www', while the generated rule explicitly includes 'http://', 'https://', and 'www.'â€”which are more precise URL prefixes. They identify similar key features, but the generated rule's inclusion of 'https://' and explicit mention of 'http://' makes it slightly more comprehensive. On most inputs, they would produce similar classifications, but the slight difference in pattern specificity (e.g., whether 'http' alone suffices in the ground truth) accounts for the small gap. Overall, their core concepts are aligned, but the phrasing and pattern details differ slightly.
